info.game_comments:
Justin Bernbach game 5.

Ask Alex #18: Married with children.

(2, 1).clue: Coming in at No. 1 on the list is this "Queen of Soul"

(3, 1).clue: A Texas rice grower known for his high-quality crops inspired this rice brand

(4, 1).clue: In the Pacific, at 20 degrees 15 minutes north latitude, 156 degrees 20 minutes west longitude

(5, 1).clue: Billy Gilbert was the voice of Sneezy in this film
(5, 1).correct response: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

(2, 2).clue: "What'd I Say"?  That this R&B singer/pianist is "On My Mind" at No. 2 on the list

(3, 2).clue: Morris the Cat was taken from a shelter & found a new home as this cat food brand's spokespet

(4, 2).clue: Approximately 60 miles northwest of Mount McKinley

(5, 2).clue: The orbicularis oculi reflexively closes these when you sneeze

(2, 3).clue: The list includes Stevie Wonder (No. 9) & this female Stevie (No. 98)

(3, 3).clue: First seen in 1924, the Lady graces the screen for this Sony-owned motion picture company

(4, 3).clue: In Avoyelles Parish, 3 miles southeast of Marksville

(5, 3).clue: This once popular smokeless tobacco was kept in a box & often made one sneeze

(1, 4).clue: President Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf(2006)(also first elected female leader in Africa)

(2, 4).clue: "Mercy Mercy Me"! "What's Going On" is that this late great made the list at No. 6

(3, 4).clue: Toucan Sam "nose" how to find this Kellogg's cereal brand

(4, 4).clue: 12 miles south of Oneida & 26 miles southwest of Utica

(5, 4).clue: A photic sneeze is caused by sudden exposure to this

(6, 4).clue: To withdraw a horse from a race

(2, 5).clue: He won't be crying the "Tears Of A Clown" since he made No. 20 on the list

(3, 5).clue: The National Crime Prevention Council uses this dog to take a bite out of crime

(4, 5).clue: The northern part of the city of Worcester

(5, 5).clue: This class of drugs will stop your sneezing from hay fever by blocking your body's H1 receptors

(1, 1).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew holds a kite in Kyoto, Japan.)  Japanese kites have been interpreted as offerings to the gods & as physical embodiments of prayers linking these two places

(4, 1).clue: Music from Paul Dukas accompanies a section of this 1940 film, as the powerful wizard summons spirits

(5, 1).clue: The oldest signer was this 81-year-old Pennsylvanian

(6, 1).clue: There are a total of 17 syllables in this type of poem

(1, 2).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew shows off a geisha in Kyoto, Japan.)  Geisha & maiko used kimonos to accentuate what was the most desirable area for Japanese men--the unaji, or back of the neck, known as this in English

(4, 2).clue: A statue of a gal holding one of these bugs in Enterprise, Ala. praises it for pushing the town to try new crops

(5, 2).clue: This legislative body "shall have the sole power of impeachment"

(6, 2).clue: Whether you're Coleridge or Newton-John, it's a place of great luxury

(1, 3).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew eats rice in a restaurant in Tokyo, Japan.)  Never leave your chopsticks sticking up out of the rice, as this resembles incense sticks used at these solemn events

(4, 3).clue: Eddie Murphy took the cake when this tubular snack looked for the "nuttiest celebrity laugh" in 1999

(5, 3).clue: A Bill of Rights motion by George Mason, author of this state's Declaration of Rights, was rejected

(6, 3).clue: A fast-growing climbing vine all over the southern United States

(1, 4).clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew holds up a hat in textile shop in Kyoto, Japan.)  This fabric has been dyed with sukumo, this dye that was once used only by aristocracy

(2, 4).clue: Thomas Gibson as an FBI profiler:" ____ Minds"

(4, 4).clue: This island nation may have been named for 3 peaks on one island & something smoked by natives on the other

(5, 4).clue: An amendment becomes law when the legislatures of this fraction of the states ratify it

(6, 4).clue: Oh, you're going to take this obnoxiously pious hyphenated 3-word attitude with me, are you?

(1, 5).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew holds up two Japanese swords.)  A long katana & a short wakizashi were carried by these masterless samurai who came in a famous group of 47

(4, 5).clue: This title guy's pal says, "That... hard-hearted wench, that Rosaline, torments him so, that he will sure run mad"

(5, 5).clue: Article IV guarantees "to every State in this Union" this "Form of Government"

(6, 5).clue: The 2 U.S. state capitals that fit the category

(0, 0).clue: Forbes magazine uses "BRIC", an acronym for these 4 large nations advancing in economic power
